sentences: C. P. Spencer (born Crathman Plato Spencer, January 13, 1938 â€“ October 20, 2004) was an American musician, singer, songwriter and record producer for the Motown label in the late 1960s and early 1970s.
He was a native of Detroit, Michigan.

As of April 2013, Originals' Hank Dixon is now the only surviving, and active, founding member of that original group; Spinners' Henry Fambrough is now the only surviving, and active, founding member of that group; Dixon and Lamont Dozier are the only surviving members of the Voice Masters.
